    "name": "Number of elements in n-th string generated by a Kolakoski(5,1) rule starting with a(1)=1.",
    "comment": [
        "Each string is derived from the previous string using the Kolakoski(5,1) rule and the additional condition: \"string begins with 1 if previous string ends with 5 and vice versa\". The strings are 1 -> 5 -> 11111 -> 51515 -> 11111511111511111 -> ... and each one contains 1,1,5,5,17,... elements.",
        "Equals inverse binomial transform of A025579. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 04 2010"
    ],
    "link": [
        "<a href=\"/index/Rec#order_03\">Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients</a>, signature (0, 3, 2)."
    ],
    "formula": [
        "a(1) = a(2) = 1, a(n) = a(n-1) + 2*a(n-2) - 2*(-1)^n.",
        "G.f.: x*(1+x+2*x^2)/((1-2*x) * (1+x)^2). a(n) = (2^(n+2)+(-1)^n*(5-6*n))/9. - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 01 2010"
